p: The increased vascular permeability and abnormal hemostasis are transient and usually resolve within 48–72 hours. However, convalescence may be prolonged in adults, who sometimes experience profound tiredness, esthenia, and depression for several weeks after recovery ( Seet et al., 2007b). Loss of hair has also been reported during convalescence. Dysfunction of specific organs (e.g., hepatic failure or myocarditis) may persist for several weeks after resolution of the vasculopathy ( Qiu et al., 1993).
